content:
• Thursday, November 17, 2011
  • MRVL

    Marvell (NASDAQ:MRVL) is now up 4.7% AH in the wake of its FQ3 report (I, II), after the company...

    Marvell (NASDAQ:MRVL) is now up 4.7% AH in the wake of its FQ3 report (I, II), after the company uses its earnings call to guide for FQ4 EPS of $0.21-$0.25. While below a $0.27 consensus, the guidance is better than many feared, given the chipmaker's exposure to a hard drive market decimated by Thai flooding.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:27 PM
  • FL

    Shares of Foot Locker (NYSE:FL) gain 5.5% in AH trading after the firm beats estimates for...

    Shares of Foot Locker (NYSE:FL) gain 5.5% in AH trading after the firm beats estimates for top-line and bottom-line results with its Q3 report. The athletic footwear and apparel seller saw comparable-store sales increase 7.4% during the last quarter after analysts projected only a 5%-6% gain.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM
  • DPS-OLD

    Dr. Pepper Snapple (NYSE:DPS-OLD) gains 1.3% AH after announcing a $1B stock buyback, good for...

    Dr. Pepper Snapple (NYSE:DPS-OLD) gains 1.3% AH after announcing a $1B stock buyback, good for roughly 13% of outstanding shares at their current price. The company adds it's repurchased $1.5B worth of shares through prior authorizations.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM
  • JCI

    Tyco (TYC) gains 1.9% AH on reports it will spin off its flow control division, and its home...

    Tyco (TYC) gains 1.9% AH on reports it will spin off its flow control division, and its home security products division. Tyco shares rose on Wedenesday following the company's FQ4 beat.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:53 PM
  • CRM

    More on Salesforce.com's FQ3: Deferred revenue (a closely-watched figure) was $918M, up 38% Y/Y...

    More on Salesforce.com's FQ3: Deferred revenue (a closely-watched figure) was $918M, up 38% Y/Y but down 2% Q/Q. Free cash flow was $94M, up 77% Y/Y.  Company expects FY13 revenue of $2.88B-$2.92B, above $2.79B consensus. Says it will provide FY13 EPS guidance in February. CRM -10.4% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM | 1 Comment
  • MRVL

    More on Marvell Technology (NASDAQ:MRVL): Q3 results largely in-line with revenue, but toward...

    More on Marvell Technology (NASDAQ:MRVL): Q3 results largely in-line with revenue, but toward the lower end of estimates. Investors will be looking for more guidance on the company's conference call to better determine how it's being impacted by hard-disk drive manufacturing issues due to the flooding in Thailand. Shares +1.7% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • FUELQ

    Microcap energy logistics company SMF Energy (FUEL -8.8%) takes a hit today after reporting that...

    Microcap energy logistics company SMF Energy (FUEL -8.8%) takes a hit today after reporting that its CEO and chairman, Richard Gathright, will be retiring. The Board appoints Steven Goldberg to be the new CEO and President, while Larry Mulkey, a current director, will assume the role of Chairman.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM
  • RMBS

    Rambus (RMBS +23.6%) is rallying today following the bloodbath that occurred yesterday...

    Rambus (RMBS +23.6%) is rallying today following the bloodbath that occurred yesterday afternoon, on account of the unfavorable verdict issued for its 7-year antitrust suit against Micron (MU -5.9%) and Hynix. Though JPMorgan downgraded Rambus to Neutral in response, its remarks about the selloff being overdone, and the verdict having no impact on existing licensing deals, could be lifting shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 2 Comments
  • SF

    Stifel Financial (SF +2.6%), which may be closing in on buying Morgan Keegan, is initiated at...

    Stifel Financial (SF +2.6%), which may be closing in on buying Morgan Keegan, is initiated at Raymond James at Outperform with a $38 price target, espousing the stability of Stifel's retail advisory foundation and limited risk-taking, which "isn't nearly as sensitive to the threat of a European financial system collapse or a double-dip recession in the U.S."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • CF

    Adding pressure to the slide in CF Industries (CF -11.8%) - in addition to falling corn prices -...

    Adding pressure to the slide in CF Industries (CF -11.8%) - in addition to falling corn prices - is a report from England-based Profercy research saying that Ukraine gas prices may be set for a "major cut." This will reduce the cost advantage for North American nitrogen-based crop nutrient producers.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM | 2 Comments
  • WNR

    Deutsche cuts its rating on two independent oil refiners (I, II), saying they're most exposed to...

    Deutsche cuts its rating on two independent oil refiners (I, II), saying they're most exposed to the shrinking Brent-WTI spread. The bank lowers: Delek ( DK -9%) and Western Refining (WNR -9.5%) to Hold.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM
  • SBH

    Sally Beauty Holdings (SBH -4.3%) gets hit by a Barclays Capital downgrade to Equalweight on...

    Sally Beauty Holdings (SBH -4.3%) gets hit by a Barclays Capital downgrade to Equalweight on valuation. The stock has had a great run this year, up over 67% since the beginning of March.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM
  • CF

    CF Industries (CF -10.6%) is one of the day's biggest losers, as fertilizer producers sell...

    CF Industries (CF -10.6%) is one of the day's biggest losers, as fertilizer producers sell off on falling corn prices. "The perception among investors is that as the price of corn drops farmers use less fertilizer, although that is not always the case. Fertilizer stocks are highly correlated to the corn price,” Atlantic Equities' Colin Isaac says. Also: AGU -6.4%, MOS -6.1%, POT -4.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • LUK-OLD

    Jefferies (JEF -2.9%) CEO Richard Handler expects the pressures on his firm’s stock and...

    Jefferies (JEF -2.9%) CEO Richard Handler expects the pressures on his firm’s stock and bonds will ease as memories fade of MF Global's failure: “Some bond investors sell first and ask questions later. We expect the market to return to normal pricing once we move beyond the ripple effect of the inaccuracies others have recently disseminated." (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM | 2 Comments
  • SLM

    SLM Corp. (SLM -8%) dips on a report that Consumer Financial Protection Bureau is planning to...

    SLM Corp. (SLM -8%) dips on a report that Consumer Financial Protection Bureau is planning to collect public comments on private student loans and related services, an effort that's likely to have a negative impact on the nation's largest student lender.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • CREE

    Cree (CREE -8.8%) shares slide after the company's marketing agreement which paired its Ruud...

    Cree (CREE -8.8%) shares slide after the company's marketing agreement which paired its Ruud Lighting specification-grade BetaLED exterior LED luminaires with Carmanah's stand-alone solar power engines is discontinued.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • MSFT

    LinkedIn (LNKD +5.4%) shares are up sharply today after its offer of 8.75M shares priced at just...

    LinkedIn (LNKD +5.4%) shares are up sharply today after its offer of 8.75M shares priced at just a fractional discount yesterday. Combined with Angie’s List (ANGI +21.8%) shares jumping post-IPO, it seems that investors still can’t get enough of Internet and social media companies.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM | 3 Comments
  • MGAM

    Multimedia Games Holding (MGAM +2%) moves up after its FQ4 results easily beat estimates as...

    Multimedia Games Holding (MGAM +2%) moves up after its FQ4 results easily beat estimates as gambling-operations revenue grew 10% Y/Y. The company also raises guidance, anticipating higher revenue and net income in FY12.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM
  • CATO

    Shares of Cato (CATO +3.4%) trade higher after the firm beats Q3 earnings estimates by a penny...

    Shares of Cato (CATO +3.4%) trade higher after the firm beats Q3 earnings estimates by a penny on lower-than-expected revenue. The retailer says that after factoring in a weakening same-store sales trend, it expects Q4 EPS to fall in the lower end of its original guidance range of $0.32-$0.35.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM
  • DCI

    Donaldson (DCI -2.5%) dips after its FQ1 earnings beat on a per share basis, but came up short...

    Donaldson (DCI -2.5%) dips after its FQ1 earnings beat on a per share basis, but came up short on revenue. Earnings rose 29% Y/Y, led by double-digit percentage sales growth at its engine-products business, but profit fell short due to rising commodities costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM
  • BKS

    Barnes & Noble (BKS +7.2%) is spiking in afternoon trading, hitting a 3-month high after...

    Barnes & Noble (BKS +7.2%) is spiking in afternoon trading, hitting a 3-month high after Stifel upgrades shares to Buy, and sets a $25 PT. With a huge percentage of B&N's float shorted, it doesn't take much to trigger a surge.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM
  • CTRX

    SXC Health Solutions' (SXCI +6.2%) acquisition of privately-held smaller rival HealthTrans...

    SXC Health Solutions' (SXCI +6.2%) acquisition of privately-held smaller rival HealthTrans for $250M, which will boost its presence in the pharmacy benefit management market, is applauded by GMP Securities' Sera Kim: It "gives SXC more scale [and] opportunities to convert some of HealthTrans' [healthcare information technology] customers to PBM customers."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM
  • BK

    BNY Mellon (BK -3.2%) dips after SunTrust cuts the shares to to Neutral from Buy, citing...

    BNY Mellon (BK -3.2%) dips after SunTrust cuts the shares to to Neutral from Buy, citing valuation and a lack of catalysts.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM
  • KODK

    Shares of Eastman Kodak (EK) show signs of life - up 6.4% - after the WSJ reports the company...

    Shares of Eastman Kodak (EK) show signs of life - up 6.4% - after the WSJ reports the company looks to sell its online photo-sharing unit. Sources say a deal worth "hundreds of millions of dollars" is sought.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM
  • STT

    State Street (STT -3.3%) underperforms the market today after Suntrust cut its rating on the...

    State Street (STT -3.3%) underperforms the market today after Suntrust cut its rating on the stock to Neutral from Buy, citing valuation. The stock has been on a tear recently, up nearly 40% since early October.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM
  • DLPH

    Delphi Automotive (NYSE:DLPH) opened for trading at $21.25, and is currently changing hands at...

    Delphi Automotive (NYSE:DLPH) opened for trading at $21.25, and is currently changing hands at $21.46, down 2.5% from its $22/share IPO price. (S-1 filing)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:36 PM
  • PETM

    PetSmart (PETM -1.3%) follows the market lower after reporting FQ3 sales of $1.5B (+8% Y/Y) and...

    PetSmart (PETM -1.3%) follows the market lower after reporting FQ3 sales of $1.5B (+8% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.50, beating consensus by $10M and $0.02. Same-store sales rose 6.1% Y/Y (up from 5% in FQ2), and $70M in shares were repurchased. The company expects FQ4 EPS of $0.85-$0.89 ($0.89 consensus), with same-store sales growth in the low-to-mid single digits. UBS is reiterating a Buy. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM
  • WSM

    Williams-Sonoma (WSM +0.3%) clings to positive territory after its Q3 beat estimates earlier...

    Williams-Sonoma (WSM +0.3%) clings to positive territory after its Q3 beat estimates earlier today. The high-end home-furnishings retailer has seen strong earnings growth over the past year as its merchandising and marketing plans have allowed it to gain market share despite overall softness in the sector. The company also reaffirms its Q4 outlook and lifts its FY12 EPS estimate to between $2.21 - $2.26 per share.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM
  • SIRI

    Sirius (SIRI +2.4%) trades higher after announcing that legendary Rolling Stones bassist Bill...

    Sirius (SIRI +2.4%) trades higher after announcing that legendary Rolling Stones bassist Bill Wyman will begin hosting a three-part music series starting today. The show will feature Wyman selecting his favorite music and sharing stories about artists he has worked with, as well as the musicians who have inspired him throughout his career.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM | 7 Comments

  • The sell-off isn't sparing the commodity sector, nearly all of which is lit up bright red. WTI...

    The sell-off isn't sparing the commodity sector, nearly all of which is lit up bright red. WTI oil falls 2.9%, back below $100. Gold -3.1% at $1,719. Silver -6.2% at $31.72. Copper -2.8% at $3.38. Corn -4.1% at $6.16.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM | 1 Comment
  • LUK-OLD

    Stocks slide to their lows of session, the DJIA dropping more than 150 points in a few minutes,...

    Stocks slide to their lows of session, the DJIA dropping more than 150 points in a few minutes, now -1.5%, Nasdaq -2.1%. Risk currencies move as well, including the aussie, below parity vs. the greenback for the first time in 5 weeks. New YTD lows for euro-troubled Jefferies (JEF -7.4%)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM
  • ENB

    Enbridge (ENB +2.4%) gets a boost from upgrades to Buy from Canaccord and TD Securities after...

    Enbridge (ENB +2.4%) gets a boost from upgrades to Buy from Canaccord and TD Securities after the company announced yesterday that it plans to buy a stake in the Seaway Pipeline.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • SJM

    J.M. Smucker (SJM -1.1%) recalls about 300 cases of Natural Chunky Peanut Butter due to a...

    J.M. Smucker (SJM -1.1%) recalls about 300 cases of Natural Chunky Peanut Butter due to a self-reported Salmonella threat based on a routine sampling of jars it conducted. Shares have recovered some ground after tailing off over 2% after the firm guided FY12 EPS lower.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • AAL

    Shares of American Airlines (AMR -8%) head south again - now down 39% over the last month -...

    Shares of American Airlines (AMR -8%) head south again - now down 39% over the last month - after the company confirms it failed to reach a labor agreement with its pilots union, only saying that it plans to meet again on an undisclosed date. Insiders say the two sides will wait two weeks before meeting again to attempt to bridge a "wide disparity," a stretch of time that isn't likely to cool off bankruptcy chatter from analysts.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM
  • BTH

    Shares of Blyth (BTH +2.7%) see a bounce after the firm sets a special cash dividend of...

    Shares of Blyth (BTH +2.7%) see a bounce after the firm sets a special cash dividend of $1.50/share for shareholders to be paid on Dec. 15.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • GES

    Guess (GES -2.4%) dips after BofA Merrill Lynch cuts it to Underperform. Merrill says the...

    Guess (GES -2.4%) dips after BofA Merrill Lynch cuts it to Underperform. Merrill says the apparel company has heavy exposure to Europe - 40% of total revenues - and faces challenging macro trends and a more muted outlook for its European business in FY13.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM
  • YOKU

    Chinese Internet stocks are selling off, as Youku.com's (YOKU -19%) weak Q3 report (I, II)...

    Chinese Internet stocks are selling off, as Youku.com's (YOKU -19%) weak Q3 report (I, II) offsets better reports (I, II) from NetEase.com (NTES +5%) and Qihoo 360 (QIHU +0.2%). BIDU -3.1%. SINA -3.3%. RENN -3.5%. TUDO -5.4%. SOHU -2.2%. PWRD -5%. GA -2.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM | 1 Comment
  • ANGI

    Angie's List (ANGI +24%) posts its first post-IPO trades, jumping as high as $18 from the...

    Angie's List (ANGI +24%) posts its first post-IPO trades, jumping as high as $18 from the offering price of $13 (currently $16.15).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM | 3 Comments
  • LPS

    Lender Processing Services (LPS -3.3%) trades lower after a Nevada grand jury hands down...

    Lender Processing Services (LPS -3.3%) trades lower after a Nevada grand jury hands down criminal indictments against two of its title officers in connection with allegedly directing and supervising a robo-signing scheme. The indictment claims the two individuals were responsible for overseeing a process in which documents filed in a large number of foreclosure cases were signed without proper legal review.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM | 1 Comment
  • NTES

    Chinese online game developer NetEase.com (NTES +5.2%) trades higher after reporting Q3 revenue...

    Chinese online game developer NetEase.com (NTES +5.2%) trades higher after reporting Q3 revenue of $314.8M (+40% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.99, beating consensus by a solid $33M and $0.11. Piper is lifting its PT to $66, claiming NetEase's growing game portfolio will allow it to "strengthen its leading position" in the Chinese market. Rival Changyou.com (CYOU +1.7%) is also moving higher.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • CHTP

    Chelsea Therapeutics (CHTP +4.2%) jumps after saying the FDA has accepted its New Drug...

    Chelsea Therapeutics (CHTP +4.2%) jumps after saying the FDA has accepted its New Drug Application for Northera, a treatment for symptomatic neurogenic orthostatic hypotension, under priority review. Priority review is assigned to drugs that have the potential to offer major advances in treatment or provide a treatment where no adequate therapy exists.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM
  • EQIX

    Shares of Equinix (EQIX +3.7%) shoot higher after the data center company announces a $250M...

    Shares of Equinix (EQIX +3.7%) shoot higher after the data center company announces a $250M share repurchasement program that it aims to complete by the end of Dec. 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • NTAP

    Unsurprisingly, some storage-related names are selling off following NetApp's (NTAP -11.7%)...

    Unsurprisingly, some storage-related names are selling off following NetApp's (NTAP -11.7%) disappointing FQ2 report (I, II, III). EMC -2.6%. STX -1.4%. WDC -1.4%. LSI-OLD -1.8%. OCZ -3.9%. SNDK -2.6%. QTM-OLD -2.7%. (NTAP transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM
  • T

    Leap Wireless (LEAP -4.8%) dips after Jefferies assumes coverage with a tepid Hold rating,...

    Leap Wireless (LEAP -4.8%) dips after Jefferies assumes coverage with a tepid Hold rating, saying 2012 is going to present a more challenging competitive landscape in pre-paid phone service.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • MRVL

    Marvell (MRVL -5.2%) suffers more analyst disrespect ahead of its FQ3 report this afternoon, as...

    Marvell (MRVL -5.2%) suffers more analyst disrespect ahead of its FQ3 report this afternoon, as JMP reduces its rating on the stock to Underperform with a $12.50 target price, citing "elevated risks to its TD-3G and Wi-Fi initiatives in calendar 2012 that will negate the ability of this segment to generate growth going forward." At least four analysts have cut estimates in the past two days (also).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM
  • HOG

    A dealership survey conducted by Robert Baird finds that the inventory of new Harley-Davidson...

    A dealership survey conducted by Robert Baird finds that the inventory of new Harley-Davidson (HOG -3.5%) motorcycles is at its lowest point in 10 years. Though reduced inventory can help support pricing and brand value for HOG bikes, it's a delicate tightrope the company walks between sacrificing revenue to achieve a "scarcity" value.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM | 1 Comment
  • VIAS

    ViaSystems (VIAS +21.2%) pops after withdrawing its plans to sell 4M shares a week after it...

    ViaSystems (VIAS +21.2%) pops after withdrawing its plans to sell 4M shares a week after it announced the offering, citing market volatility and a collapse in its share price.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • LUK-OLD

    In spite of significantly trimming its Euro sovereign debt exposure earlier this month,...

    In spite of significantly trimming its Euro sovereign debt exposure earlier this month, Jefferies (JEF -2.7%) made a new 52-week low this morning, before rebounding a little. Soaring yields for the company's bonds could be a factor. S&P gives Jefferies a BBB credit rating, but the 10.1% yield on Jefferies' 2019 bonds is higher than that of many junk-rated notes.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM
  • BKE

    Buckle (BKE -5.6%) dips despite its Q3 results beating estimates earlier this morning. Earnings...

    Buckle (BKE -5.6%) dips despite its Q3 results beating estimates earlier this morning. Earnings rose 12% Y/Y as the maker of Diesel and Guess brands posted double-digit growth on better same-store sales, but margins narrowed on a 13% Y/Y jump in the cost of sales due to a spike in labor and material costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM
  • IDXX

    IDEXX Laboratories (NASDAQ:IDXX) trades 7% higher after the firm dodges a bullet when U.K.'s...

    IDEXX Laboratories (NASDAQ:IDXX) trades 7% higher after the firm dodges a bullet when U.K.'s Office of Fair Trading concludes (PR) it doesn't have any grounds to take action over allegations it competed unfairly in its dominant position in the veterinary diagnostic testing industry.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM
  • SHLDQ

    You won't find this in Sears' (SHLD -6.5%) dismal earnings report, but it's far more important...

    You won't find this in Sears' (SHLD -6.5%) dismal earnings report, but it's far more important in the long run: Its stores are dumpy. Retail experts say Sears has spent much less on remodeling and updating its aging stores than competitors such as Macy's and Wal-Mart. While store chains traditionally spend $6-$8/sq. ft. on annual maintenance, Sears spends ~$1.90.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM | 6 Comments
  • DGIT

    Shares of DG FastChannel (DGIT -12.2%) take a pounding after Piper Jaffray takes its rating down...

    Shares of DG FastChannel (DGIT -12.2%) take a pounding after Piper Jaffray takes its rating down to Underperform from Neutral with a lowly price target of $11. DG was hit last week with an earnings disappointment and CEO shakeup, contributing to a loss of 30% from its share price over the last 5 trading sessions.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM
  • AMAT

    Applied Materials (AMAT -4.8%) is selling off post-earnings, as consensus-beating FQ4 figures...

    Applied Materials (AMAT -4.8%) is selling off post-earnings, as consensus-beating FQ4 figures get overshadowed by weak guidance and truly dismal order data. The company says FQ4 will represent a bottom for orders, but cautious CC remarks about chip capacity utilization rates and LCD TV demand probably aren't going over well, nor might a forecast for solar equipment sales to fall at least 50% next year. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM
  • PEP

    CNBC's David Faber reports Nelson Peltz's Trian Fund was in Pepsi (NYSE:PEP) just for a...

    CNBC's David Faber reports Nelson Peltz's Trian Fund was in Pepsi (NYSE:PEP) just for a short-term trade and no longer has a stake. This kills the idea that Peltz was going to push for value-increasing break-up of the company. Shares -2.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM | 1 Comment
  • ZOLL

    Zoll Medical (NASDAQ:ZOLL) +18.8% at the open, after reporting FQ4 EPS of $0.52, vs. $0.33 in...

    Zoll Medical (NASDAQ:ZOLL) +18.8% at the open, after reporting FQ4 EPS of $0.52, vs. $0.33 in the year-ago period and better than analyst estimates of $0.49, and a 65% rise in profit on strong sales of its LifeVest device. The maker of defibrillators forecasts 2012 revenue will rise as much as 19% vs. analyst consensus of ~16%, and reports a $50M share buyback program.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM
  • SLXP

    Salix Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SLXP) +8.4% premarket after saying that an FDA advisory panel...

    Salix Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SLXP) +8.4% premarket after saying that an FDA advisory panel supports its proposed trial to test repeat treatment cycles of its Xifaxan tablets for irritable bowel syndrome. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • PLCE

    Premarket gainers: PLCE +13%. SLXP +6%. RMBS +4%. MOS +4%.Losers: YOKU -15%. NTAP -9%. PEIX -6%....

    Premarket gainers: PLCE +13%. SLXP +6%. RMBS +4%. MOS +4%.
    Losers: YOKU -15%. NTAP -9%. PEIX -6%. LPS -5%. LYG -5%. AMAT -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • GME

    More on GameStop's FQ3 report: Same-store sales fell 0.6%, an improvement from FQ2's 9.1% drop....

    More on GameStop's FQ3 report: Same-store sales fell 0.6%, an improvement from FQ2's 9.1% drop. Digital sales rose 59% Y/Y, and $42.5M in shares were repurchased. For its pivotal FQ4, GameStop expects EPS of $1.66-$1.76 ($1.74 consensus) and same-store sales growth of 0-2%. GME +3.7% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:45 AM
  • AMAG

    AMAG Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:AMAG) +4.7% premarket after announcing it has hired Jefferies...

    AMAG Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:AMAG) +4.7% premarket after announcing it has hired Jefferies as a strategic advisor to "explore all opportunities to enhance stockholder value," including a "potential sale of the company."

     
     
     
     
    | 8:42 AM
  • MOS

    Mosaic (NYSE:MOS) announces it will buy back close to $1.2B of its common stock from the...

    Mosaic (NYSE:MOS) announces it will buy back close to $1.2B of its common stock from the Margaret Cargill Trusts at yesterday's closing price of $54.58. The transaction completes the disposition of 157M shares that were designated to be sold in the 15-months following the split from Cargill. Another 129M shares remain subject to transfer restrictions until at least Nov. 2013. Shares +3.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:35 AM
  • NTAP

    NetApp (NASDAQ:NTAP) is down 8.7% after delivering weak guidance to go with its FQ2 beat. During...

    NetApp (NASDAQ:NTAP) is down 8.7% after delivering weak guidance to go with its FQ2 beat. During its CC, the company noted strong Asia-Pac demand and a rebound in financial sector orders, and touted the rich feature set of the latest version of its Data ONTAP OS, but also voiced concerns about macro issues and Thai flooding. Oppenheimer (Perform) thinks "increased competition from Dell (DELL-OLD) and EMC" could also be an issue.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:33 AM
  • PERY

    Shares of Perry Ellis (NASDAQ:PERY) implode, down 20.4%, premarket, after the apparel company...

    Shares of Perry Ellis (NASDAQ:PERY) implode, down 20.4%, premarket, after the apparel company misses estimates for Q3 revenue and profit, while also steering FY12 guidance lower. CEO George Feldenkreis blames a lack of execution from the showroom to the retail floor for the poor results, and says the firm expects to see "elevated levels" of markdowns in Q4.
